definitions.definition: A building or other place where manufacturing takes place.
examples: History has shown that, even without cheap labor, factories run perfectly well.

definitions.definition: A device or process that produces or manufactures something.
In a computer program or library, a function , method , etc. which creates an object .
The original state of an electronic device , as it was when it came from the manufacturer .
examples: factory settings; factory defaults; a factory reset

definitions.definition: The position or state of being a factor .
A trading establishment, especially set up by merchants working in a foreign country.

main_definition: A building or other place where manufacturing takes place. [from 17th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( UK , slang ) A police station . [from 19th c.]
A device or process that produces or manufactures something.
( programming ) In a computer program or library, a function , method , etc. which creates an object .
( attributive ) The original state of an electronic device , as it was when it came from the manufacturer .
( chiefly Scotland , now rare ) The position or state of being a factor . [from 16th c.]
( historical ) A trading establishment, especially set up by merchants working in a foreign country. [from 16th c.]
